alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; South Central Mountains; Southwest Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 30 at 2:58PM MST until January 01 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations in excess of 6 inches are possible, especially above 7,500 feet. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph creating areas of reduced visibilities in blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central, northwest, and west central New Mexico. * WHEN...From Friday morning through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. Some roads may be closed. Significant travel delays are possible. These hazardous conditions will impact the holiday travel period.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; South Central Mountains; Southwest Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau
